justification: The Methods section states: "Depression symptoms were measured with the Beck Depression Inventory total score."

measured_by: State-Trait Inventory for Cognitive and Somatic Anxiety (STICSA)
justification: The authors note: "Anxiety symptoms were measured using the State-Trait Inventory for Cognitive and Somatic Anxiety total score."
It is reported that "Exposure to traumatic events was measured using the Trauma Assessment for Adults total score."
The article specifies: "Problematic cannabis consumption was measured using the 21-item Cannabis Problems Questionnaire."
The same sentence continues that problematic cannabis use was also assessed with "the Marijuana Problem Scale."
Methods state: "Problematic alcohol consumption was measured using the Short Michigan Alcohol Screening Test."
During screening, "Axis 1 psychiatric disorder ... was assessed with the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID-IV)."
The paper explains: "Subjective mood state ... was measured with Visual Analogue Scales (VAS). The VAS employed during sampling and administration sessions comprised 35 items."
construct: Subjective mood state (high, miserable, tired, etc.)

measured_by: Visual Analogue Scale item ‘I want cannabis’
justification: Cue-reactivity was quantified as "ratings of 'I want cannabis'" on a VAS before and after cue exposure.

measured_by: Visual Analogue Scale item ‘I want a snack’
justification: Similarly, craving for food was assessed with VAS ratings of "I want a snack."

measured_by: Decision strength rating (1–5 scale) in the choice task
justification: The task description notes: "The decision strength ratings provided a behavioral measure of the participant's SV for that cannabis/snack option relative to the monetary option."
